sections.name: overview
sections.prompt: Provide a compelling 2-3 sentence overview of this book or manuscript, highlighting its significance, rarity, or notable features.

sections.name: bibliographic_details
sections.prompt: Include full bibliographic information: author, title, publisher, place and date of publication, edition, and format.

sections.name: physical_description
sections.prompt: Describe the binding, paper, illustrations, typography, and any special features such as plates, maps, or fold-outs.

sections.name: condition_assessment
sections.prompt: Provide detailed condition notes using standard bibliographic terminology, noting any defects, repairs, or notable preservation.

sections.name: provenance_inscriptions
sections.prompt: Document any ownership inscriptions, bookplates, stamps, marginalia, or known provenance.

sections.name: significance
sections.prompt: Explain the literary, historical, or cultural significance of this work and its importance to collectors.

description_structure.tone: scholarly yet accessible, precise bibliographic language, collector-focused

first_edition_identification: Check publisher's statement on copyright page
Look for number line (1 should be present for first printing)
Compare to known first edition bibliographic points
Check publication date matches first publication year
Verify binding matches first edition specifications
valuable_factors: Original dust jacket in good condition

condition_criteria.Fine: As new, no defects, appears unread
condition_criteria.Near Fine: Close to Fine with only minor signs of handling
condition_criteria.Very Good: Shows some wear, but no major defects
condition_criteria.Good: Average used copy, all pages present, binding intact
condition_criteria.Fair: Obviously worn, may have markings or loose pages
condition_criteria.Poor: Heavily worn, may have damage, sold as reading copy only

dust_jacket_condition.Very Good: Some wear, small tears or chips

title.example: Hemingway The Old Man and the Sea First Edition 1952 Signed

authentication_prompts: Verify edition points against authoritative bibliographies
Examine paper, typography, and binding for period consistency
Check for signs of sophisticated forgery in signatures
Compare to known authentic examples when possible
Consider professional authentication for high-value items
reference_sources: Collected Books: The Guide to Identification and Values
